Detailed Description

Contains the parameters of a section of polynomials for position, velocity, and acceleration for one single degree of freedom.

The three polynomials

describe the trajectory within one section and are valid until the time RMLPolynomial::Time_ValidUntil. An entire trajectory for one degree of freedom consists of a set of such polynomial segments.

See also:
RMLOutputPolynomials
RMLOutputParameters
Example 2 — Making Use of Output Parameters of the Position-based algorithm
Example 5 — Making Use of Output Parameters of the Velocity-based algorithm

Member Data Documentation

double RMLPolynomial::AccelerationPolynomialCoefficients[2]

Array containing the coefficients of the acceleration polynomial.

The two elements of this double array contain the coefficients of the polynomial

  • AccelerationPolynomialCoefficients[0]
  • AccelerationPolynomialCoefficients[1]

This polynomial segment is valid until the time instant RMLPolynomial::Time_ValidUntil.

double RMLPolynomial::PositionPolynomialCoefficients[4]

Array containing the coefficients of the position polynomial.

The four elements of this double array contain the coefficients of the polynomial

  • PositionPolynomialCoefficients[0]
  • PositionPolynomialCoefficients[1]
  • PositionPolynomialCoefficients[2]
  • PositionPolynomialCoefficients[3]

This polynomial segment is valid until the time instant RMLPolynomial::Time_ValidUntil.

double RMLPolynomial::Time_ValidUntil

Time in seconds until this polynomial is valid.

double RMLPolynomial::VelocityPolynomialCoefficients[3]

Array containing the coefficients of the velocity polynomial.

The three elements of this double array contain the coefficients of the polynomial

  • VelocityPolynomialCoefficients[0]
  • VelocityPolynomialCoefficients[1]
  • VelocityPolynomialCoefficients[2]

This polynomial segment is valid until the time instant RMLPolynomial::Time_ValidUntil.
